newsitem.title: USA: El Paso unit to buy stake in Argentine firm.
newsitem.headline: El Paso unit to buy stake in Argentine firm.

text.p: El Paso Energy International Co, a unit of El Paso Energy Corp, said Wednesday it intends to acquire a 29 percent interest in CAPSA, a privately-held, integrated energy company in Argentina.
El Paso said in a release that the acquisition is valued at $157 million, and terms include options to increase the unit's interest up to 45 percent in the Argentinian company.
CAPSA was incorporated in 1977 for the purpose of exploring for, producing, and selling liquid hydrocarbons, El Paso said in a release.
CAPSA's assets include 100 percent ownership of the Diadema Oil Field and 55 percent ownership of CAPEX SA, a publicly traded company that owns the 382-megawatt Agua del Cajon gas-fired power plant.
This plant, operational since 1995, the release said, buys gas from the Agua del Cajon field, also owned by CAPEX.

El Paso said an additional 240-megawatt combined cycle expansion is now under development at the Agua del Cajon plant, and CAPEX also owns 24 percent of the 76-megawatt Energia del Sur gas-fired power plant.
William Wise, chief executive officer of El Paso Energy, said in the release that CAPSA is a "well-managed company with an excellent reputation in the Argentine energy sector."
He added that the Agua del Cajon plant is the only thermal plant in Argentina with captive gas reserves, and it is also the lowest cost thermal plant in the country.
Wise said the transaction, expected to close by the end of March, will help the company expand its presence in the South American energy market and will be accretive to earnings.
